snippet.textDisplay:
AHHHH💜💜MAZING..I BOUGHT MY SEWING MACHINE last April 2019, to Invest in wig making. I made A few WIGS. Sold 0 WIGS. BUT I AM SO HONORED TO HAVE THE MACHINE TO HELP OUT MY COMMUNITY, TO MAKE MASK. SO TODAY, I WILL USE MY SEWING MACHINE TO MAKE MASK TO HELP MY COMMUNITY. THANK YOU FOR SHARING THIS. IT IS SO COOL.
I will Reach out to My local community and see if They Need mask. God BLESS EVERYONE AS WE UNIT TO SAVE LIVES. AND HELP PREVENT THE SPREAD OF COVID-19. 💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜💜

snippet.textDisplay: **CAUTION**:  Unless you're planning to wear goggles or a clear face shield, COVID-19 can be contracted through your eyes.  Without protecting your eyes, this DIY mask is useless and gives a false sense of security.

snippet.textDisplay: Great! These are also appreciated by your local grocery store workers, senior center workers, and others who don't get first access to the N-95 masks in short supply. While they don't protect from the virus, they do offer protection from "spray" and, as a nurse below shared, they can help prolong the life of the N-95s.
snippet.textOriginal: Great! These are also appreciated by your local grocery store workers, senior center workers, and others who don't get first access to the N-95 masks in short supply. I'm thinking White masks, So they can be bleached and unsexed?

snippet.textDisplay: Use Tyvek house wrap as one of the layers and it lets water vapor out and does not let damp in. Place it above the flannel layer after you turn it right side out by leaving an opening in the side Pleat the fabric layers but do not try to pleat the Tyvek.I pleated the fabric before I put them together.Scientists have determined that four layers of regular fabric keeps 80% of virus out.80% better than zero and the effect of the Tyvek has not been studied.
snippet.textOriginal: Use Tyvek house wrap as one of the layers and it lets water vapor out and does not let damp in. Place it above the flannel layer after you turn it right side out by leaving an opening in the side Pleat the fabric layers but do not try to pleat the Tyvek.I pleated the fabric before I put them together.Scientists have determined that four layers of regular fabric keeps 80% of virus out.80% better than zero and the effect of the Tyvek has not been studied.

snippet.textDisplay: Please check @the fabric patch here on YouTube. Flannel doesn’t keep this particular germ out. Needs to be webbed interfacing. Nothing woven it passes thru. Interfacing is hard to come by because of this she’s got info on a substitute material that fits guidelines. Shaping is important too or it finds it’s way in. Masks need to be comfortable, breathable, washable and keep the germ out. A tweak could make all the difference in usability, as long as such loving dedicated folks are lovingly giving with their time and efforts. Thank you for posting and sharing. Simple updates make the difference. None of us knew anything about medical face masks 😷 We’re learning together. Be Well. God Bless ♥️
snippet.textOriginal: Please check @the fabric patch here on YouTube. Flannel doesn’t keep this particular germ out. Needs to be webbed interfacing. Nothing woven it passes thru. Interfacing is hard to come by because of this she’s got info on a substitute material that fits guidelines. Shaping is important too or it finds it’s way in. Masks need to be comfortable, breathable, washable and keep the germ out. A tweak could make all the difference in usability, as long as such loving dedicated folks are lovingly giving with their time and efforts. Thank you for posting and sharing. Simple updates make the difference. None of us knew anything about medical face masks 😷 We’re learning together. Be Well. God Bless ♥️

snippet.textDisplay: I was a nurse for over 30 years and wore masks every day for placing PICCs.  Today I bought a sewing machine and pulling from my 8th grade Home Ec class have made my first attempt following this tutorial.  (it's great btw!)  I'm watching it over and over as I ended up with only one ear loop....but it's a really cute cell phone case!  I will have this down pat by morning!  I have a question....how did you decide what fabrics to use, number of layers, etc.  Thanks!
snippet.textOriginal: I was a nurse for over 30 years and wore masks every day for placing PICCs.  Today I bought a sewing machine and pulling from my 8th grade Home Ec class have made my first attempt following this tutorial.  (it's great btw!)  I'm watching it over and over as I ended up with only one ear loop....but it's a really cute cell phone case!  I will have this down pat by morning!  I have a question....how did you decide what fabrics to use, number of layers, etc.  Thanks!

snippet.textDisplay: Please note that the Cambridge study about effectiveness of different materials suggested using only two layers and no inner-facing (i.e., no flannel layer) , due to breathe-abilty issues. (Some hospitals are requesting masks w/a pocket for inserting a filter.)
snippet.textOriginal: Please note that the Cambridge study about effectiveness of different materials suggested using only two layers and no inner-facing (i.e., no flannel layer) , due to breathe-abilty issues. (Some hospitals are requesting masks w/a pocket for inserting a filter.)

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks Erica I did not know how to get started till I saw your video. I had a little problem w the top pleat being too sewed down...and had to RIP it out. Now I think I got it right. Also I think next one I will make elastics 6.5 inches instead of 7. Anyhow thanks so much!!!
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks Erica I did not know how to get started till I saw your video. I had a little problem w the top pleat being too sewed down...and had to RIP it out. Now I think I got it right. Also I think next one I will make elastics 6.5 inches instead of 7. Anyhow thanks so much!!!

snippet.textDisplay: If you want to make them more resistant, get 3 packs of air filters at  home depot, cut out white filtering material, and sew into the middle. If you leave the opening on the end, the filter material could be changed.
snippet.textOriginal: If you want to make them more resistant, get 3 packs of air filters at  home depot, cut out white filtering material, and sew into the middle. If you leave the opening on the end, the filter material could be changed.

snippet.textDisplay: How long does the virus survive in fabric? My concern is if someone infected with the virus works sewing a mask, it’ll get contaminated. The ones made in factories go through a quality check process. The intention is great, but how can we make them safer to wear?  🤔
snippet.textOriginal: How long does the virus survive in fabric? My concern is if someone infected with the virus works sewing a mask, it’ll get contaminated. The ones made in factories go through a quality check process. The intention is great, but how can we make them safer to wear?  🤔

snippet.textDisplay:
I read that it's important to wash and dry the fabric before sewing it since in a hospital setting these will be washed frequently and you don't want them shrinking (especially with layers of different fabric shrinking differently).

Thanks for the great tutorial!

snippet.textDisplay: One thing I see a lot are people reusing Disposable mask.. please don’t. Wear these fabric mask instead and make sure to wash them every used specially after going out in a crowded area which you shouldn’t in the first place.. wash with hot/warm water .
snippet.textOriginal: One thing I see a lot are people reusing Disposable mask.. please don’t. Wear these fabric mask instead and make sure to wash them every used specially after going out in a crowded area which you shouldn’t in the first place.. wash with hot/warm water .
